WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN FARMERS EAT?

A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name Mr. & Mrs. Arthur Orton
Address But. Knife Sask.
Birthplace Nottingham England

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1904

For how many people did you prepare meals? 10

How often could a visit be made to the store? Not very often
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? Salt sugar flour yeast tea brown sugar syrup dried apples rolled oats

Include items not mentioned above, quality, methods of merchandising, prices, problems of storage, shortages and other details. (Use back of page if more space is needed).

We came to Manitoba in 1903. Homesteaded 1904. Got our little homestead 1907. We was on the all the time. We make our living the first years by making building for homesteaders coming in. We put up hay & done breaking for people coming in. This was good land & good country and we made out good & have been retired for 23 years. Live in a modern house.

23. Years for which you could not obtain quality methods of nourishment? Use only of prices, people or stories, characters and other facts. Use more space if necessary.

We came to Manitoba in 1903. We Homesteaded in 1904. We got our little homestead in 1907. We were on the all the time we make our living by farming. Building for Homesteaders. The first years by building Hay and Corn Breezing for coming in. We had to get Hay and Corn Breezing for people coming in. This was good land and good country and we made out good house here. We lived there for 23 years and live in a modern house.
